channel.title: Northern Trust
channel.itunes:summary: Each month this podcast series will take an expert look at issues impacting the institutional asset servicing and asset management community. From regulatory and legislative changes to product innovation worldwide, Northern Trust experts provide perspective on key industry developments facing institutions in this complex and dynamic industry.
channel.itunes:author: Institutional Investor Services

item.title: April 26, 2012 Fixed Income and Money Markets Update by Colin Robertson
item.description: No Surprises From The Fed... After the Fed's meeting, don't expect short-term interest rates to change anytime soon, says Colin Robertson, Northern Trust's Managing Director of Fixed Income. He expects interest rates to remain low through the end of 2014 at the earliest, which could be beneficial to fixed income investors for quite some time.

item.title: April 26, 2012 Fixed Income and Money Markets Update by Colin Robertson
item.description: No Surprises From The Fed... After the Fed's meeting, don't expect short-term interest rates to change anytime soon, says Colin Robertson, Northern Trust's Managing Director of Fixed Income. He expects interest rates to remain low through the end of 2014 at the earliest, which could be beneficial to fixed income investors for quite some time.

item.description: Our retiring Chief Economist gives one last review of major economies, plus some parting wisdom.

item.title: March 12, 2012 Fixed Income and Money Markets Update by Colin Robertson
item.description: The More Some Things Change..... Some things have changed in the fixed market, but many things are the same, says Colin Robertson, Northern Trust's Managing Director of Fixed Income. While fixed income markets have become less stressed than in 2011, and there appears to be a resolution to the Greek debt crisis, investors should look for the Fed to keep rates near zero until into 2014.

item.title: February 13, 2012 Fixed Income and Money Markets Update by Colin Robertson
item.description: So Far So Good in 2012 - It has been a very positive start for the fixed income markets this year, says Colin Robertson, Northern Trust's Managing Director of Fixed Income. While there are many good signs in the market, he says investors should keep their eye on the situation in Greece and possible changes in regulating money market funds.

item.description: The financial world changed in 2007-2008 with the global financial crisis, rewriting the way that risk is perceived, measured and monitored.

item.description: When investing in short-term vehicles, consideration must be given to the conflicting demands of liquidity and yield.

item.description: Growth, inflation/deflation, employment. Paul Kasriel explains it always gets back to bank credit. Paul shares some unconventional ideas to spur growth.

item.title: The Enduring Logic of a Well-Constructed Hedge Fund Portfolio
item.description: By John Krieg, CFA, CIAA, Director of Global Product Management, Jens Vinge, CFA, Product Manager, Hedge Fund of Funds and Anthony Zanolla, CFA, Senior Portfolio Manager, Hedge Fund of Funds. Institutional investors are reconsidering the role that hedge funds play in their overall portfolio. As the industry evolves, there will undoubtedly be increased regulation, greater transparency, deleveraging and increased fee scrutiny. Listen to learn why Northern Trusts hedge fund of funds professionals believe the value proposition of hedge funds, as risk stabilizers or return enhancers, remains intact.

item.title: Resilience
item.description: Listen to this podcast on how asset prices reflect investor expectations.

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update: Aftershock
item.description: This month's topic centers around emotions and how they play a crucial role in how investors process information and form expectations. Listen to a narration of this commentary by our Chief Investment Officer, Orie L. Dudley Jr.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: UK REITS
item.description: Real estate investment trusts, or REITs for short, are one of the most talked about and long-awaited investment vehicles on the United Kingdom investment scene. Find out what their arrival in 2007 really means for property companies and investors in the United Kingdom.
item.itunes:author: Penny Biggs

item.title: Sudan Free Investing - June 2007
item.description: Why have some investments been divested from companies that do business in Sudan or distribute products made in Sudan? This timely and comprehensive podcast provides some answers.
item.itunes:author: Lyle Logan

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update: The Importance of Context - November 2007
item.description: This month's topic centers around the crisis in credit markets and the ongoing weakness in housing markets that have increased downside risks to the U.S. economy. Listen to a narration of this commentary by our Chief Investment Officer, Orie L. Dudley, Jr.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update: Don't Fight the Fed - October 2007
item.description: This month's topic centers around the turmoil that has erupted in the financial markets during the past weeks. Listen to a narration of this commentary by our Chief Investment Officer, Orie L. Dudley, Jr.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update: Creating Policy Outlooks - September 2007
item.description: Several key theme have been emerging as having the potential to affect our forecasts and return projections. Some of these themes include pricing of credit risk and high leverage in the financial system. Listen to a narration of Wayne G. Bowers, Chief Investment Officer, International Markets, commentary to learn more.
item.itunes:author: Wayne G. Bowers

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update: The Beginning of Tightening Financial Conditions - August 2007
item.description: For much of the past year, global economic growth has been stimulated by widespread easing in financial conditions. On balance, global financial conditions remain supportive of growth. But some variables are becoming less supportive and modest tightening has begun. Listen to a narration of our Chief Investment Officer Orie L. Dudley's commentary to learn more.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Investment Update - Favorable Fundamentals - July 2007
item.description: The case for overweighting equities in portfolio construction remains compelling. Listen to a narration of our Chief Investment Officer, Orie L. Dudley Jr. on Favorable Fundamentals to learn why we feel stock returns will be higher going forward.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: Northern Trust Global Investments Strategic Update on Liquidity - June 2007
item.description: Liquidity is having quite an impact on the financial markets. Listen to our Chief Investment Officer, Orie L. Dudley's full commentary on Liquidity.
item.itunes:author: Orie L. Dudley

item.title: Target Date Funds
item.description: While target date funds have been in existence for several years, the recent surge in interest is a result of the Pension Protection Act which was signed into law in 2006. Many plan sponsors are adopting target date strategies as their new default investment option. Listen to this podcast to find out more about Target Date Strategies.
item.itunes:author: Susan Czochara

item.title: Portable Alpha
item.description: Considering alternatives to traditional portfolio management? There has been considerable interest by Institutional Investors around portable alpha. Several factors has contributed to this interest; listen to find out more.
item.itunes:author: John Krieg

item.title: The Pension Liability Equation/LDI
item.description: Pension Plan sponsors in Europe and North America are looking for alternatives to traditional pension management strategies. A host of issues are prompting plan sponsors to seek out new solutions with the potential to relieve the pressure building on their funds. Listen to this podcast to find out more about trends in the use of liability driven investment strategies.
item.itunes:author: Lee Freitag

item.title: Investing in China
item.description: There is no question that China is booming. The country boasts the world's fastest growing economy, one of the fastest growing middle classes and a manufacturing and industrial base set to rapidly expand for the foreseeable future. So what should an investor know before contemplating an investment in China?
item.itunes:author: Don Pollak

item.title: Cross-Border Pension Pooling Helps Multinationals Meet the Challenge of Globalization
item.description: Multinationals and investment managers who have interest in meeting the challenges of globalization will be interested in how Northern Trust has developed an innovative approach to cross border pension pooling, offering clients a unique solution to their needs.
item.itunes:author: Kathy Dugan

item.title: The Five Myths to Transition Management
item.description: Each year, institutional investors shuffle between $2 trillion and $2.5 trillion among portfolios. Given the continued search for alpha and new funding and reporting requirements, most industry analysts expect the number of portfolio restructurings to increase. As the pace of fund restructurings continues to accelerate (due to these changes), it's important to separate truth from the transition management myths.
item.itunes:author: Joe Martinez

item.title: A Structured Approach for Small Cap Investing
item.description: For the past 5 years, the small cap equity asset class has been one of the leading contributors to investors' overall performance. Fueled by today's low equity return environment, the demand for small cap products continues at a rapid pace - despite many top-quartile managers closing their doors to new investors.
item.itunes:author: Phil DeSantis

item.title: Global Pension Shift
item.description: Pension plans around the globe are adopting new investing mindsets and changing behaviors as they grapple with aging populations, funding issues and new regulations. This podcast is intended for institutional investors who want to learn more about how pension plans around the globe are responding to new pension funding laws and regulations, and the strategies - such as liability driven investing - that are being developed to deal with these issues.

item.title: Markets in Financial Instruments Directive
item.description: It has been described as the most far-reaching reform of any major financial market ever undertaken. MiFID - the Markets in Financial Instruments Directive - is a critical component of the European Commission's Financial Services Action Plan, and is due for full implementation by the end of 2007.
item.itunes:author: Penelope Biggs

item.title: The Forced Institutionalisation of the Hedge Fund Industry
item.description: With hedge fund stories constantly in the press, this podcast will be of interest to anyone who wants to find out more about the impact of inflows of institutional money on the hedge fund industry. Northern Trust seeks to explore the consequences that institutionalisation is having on investors and managers alike.
item.itunes:author: Penelope Biggs
